bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Charles S. White, January 31, 1942

div1.p: Hench informs White that he has asked Borden about letters between his father and Reed. He was glad to receive White's comments on Reed's operation.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Charles S. White, January 31, 1942
div1.p:
Mary and I certainly had a delightful
evening at your home, as I have written you.

I just received a very nice letter from
Dr. Daniel Borden and have written him, asking if he
has any letters between his father and Dr. Reed.

I am delighted to get your additional
comments and in them there is material that I can cer-
tainly use. It is interesting indeed for us to know
that you were there on the occasion of the operation.
We have in our library a copy of the Senate Document
on Yellow Fever which you mentioned. I am going to
try to pick up another copy somewhere. The Government
Printing Office has no more.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
